page.title: 03THE CHEREDDEN GARDEN CLUB
page.content: The name of the club is derived from the names of the villages - Chevington, Chedburgh, Rede and Depden. The club was started in October 1979 with just 6 members, today we have 62 members. We meet once a month at the Erskine Centre, Chedburgh, sometimes having a lecturer come along to talk on some aspect of gardening; we show slides and have discussions, as well as, a competition, raffle and refreshments. Once or twice a year we have an outing to a well known garden. We also have an 'open' evening, usually in July, when we visit members gardens. Every September is our Show with 1st 2nd & 3rd prizes for every event; a cup is given to the person with the most points. In October we elect Committee Members by voting. At Christmas we have an evening with either a Dinner & Dance or a Dinner & Games.
